end_message: Thank you for participating in the interview!
S3: What is your gender? Male — 1, Female — 2
S5: Please tell which type of biscuits you usually eat. Sandwich Biscuit, Plain Biscuit, Salty Biscuit, or Other?
S6: Please tell how frequently you eat Sandwich Biscuits. Once a week or more, 2–3 times a month, Less often than that, or Do not eat?
S7: Please tell which brands of Sandwich Biscuits you have eaten. Eclipse Biscuits, Prince Biscuits, Rio Biscuits, Lemon or Chocolate Sandwich Biscuits, or Other?
S8: Please tell whether you have eaten Eclipse biscuits in the past three months. Used to eat about 3–4 months ago, Yes currently eat, or Never eaten?
S8a: If you no longer eat Eclipse biscuits, please tell which biscuit brand(s) you switched to instead.
S8b: If you do not eat Eclipse biscuits and have chosen another brand, please tell why you use that brand.
S9: Please tell the educational qualification of the head of your household.
S10: Please tell the occupation of the head of your household.
Q1: Please tell how you liked the appearance of the last biscuit you ate. Rate on a scale of 1 to 7 — where 1 means Did not like at all and 7 means Liked very much.
Q4b: Please tell your opinion about the color shade of the last biscuit you ate. 1 means Much lighter than I prefer, and 5 means Much darker than I prefer.
Q5b: Please tell your opinion about the size of the last biscuit you ate. 1 means Much smaller than I like, and 5 means Much bigger than I like.
Q6a: Please tell, overall, how much you liked the last biscuit you ate. On a scale of 1 to 9, where 1 means Did not like at all and 9 means Liked very much.
Q6b: If you felt that you did not like this biscuit, please explain why. Kindly describe in detail.
Q7a: Please tell how much you liked the taste of the last biscuit you ate. On a scale of 1 to 7, where 1 means Did not like at all and 7 means Liked very much.
Q7b: If you felt that you did not like the taste of this biscuit, please explain why. Kindly elaborate.
Q9b: Please tell your opinion about the sweetness level of the last biscuit you ate. 1 means Much less than I prefer, and 5 means Much more than I prefer.
Q10b: Please tell your opinion about the crispiness of the last biscuit you ate. 1 means Much less crispy than I like, and 5 means Much more crispy than I like.
Q13: Now I will ask a few questions about the price of the last biscuit you ate. If this product were available in a pack of 2 biscuits priced at Rs. 30, would you buy it? Yes I would buy — 1, No I would not buy — 2, Maybe / Can't say — 3
Q15: Looking at this packaging, what do you think it is for? It looks like biscuit packaging — 1, It looks like cake packaging — 2, It looks like chocolate bar packaging — 3, It looks like sweets/confectionery packaging — 4, Not sure what it is for — 5, or Other — 6
Q15a: If you said it doesn't look like biscuit packaging, what improvements would make it appear as biscuit packaging? Make colors more vibrant/prominent — 1, Show biscuit image more clearly or larger — 2, Add more variation/pattern to the design — 3, Brand name or logo should be more visible — 4, Flavor/type should be clearly mentioned — 5, No improvement needed — 6, or Other — 7
Q15b: If you said it looks like biscuit packaging, please tell which type of biscuit it looks like.
Q17: Which of these two packagings influences your decision to buy biscuits more? And why?
